data.title: Liverpool Football Club
data.meta_description:
Liverpool Football Club | 286,143 followers on LinkedIn. Official LinkedIn page of Liverpool Football Club ðŸ”´ Stop The Hate, Report It. #RedTogether âœŠ | Liverpool Football Club was founded in 1892 and is one of the worldâ€™s most historic and famous football clubs.

Honours include 19Â League Titles, eight FA Cups, ten League Cups, sixÂ European Cups, three UEFA Cups, four European Super Cups,Â 16 Charity Shields, one FIFA Club World Cup, two Women's Super League and one Women's Championship. 

As a socially responsible club, Liverpool FC is proud of its heritage and plays a proactive role in its communities through its official charity, Liverpool FC Foundation, which helps children and families in Merseyside and beyond, and the Red Neighbours programme, which creates events and experiences specifically aimed at improving the lives of those living in and around the Anfield area (L4, L5 and L6).
data.text:
Liverpoolâ€™s Stefan Bajcetic and Vitezslav Jaros surprised LFC Foundation participants this week when they visited the Kicks Inclusion Camp at Anfield Sports and Community Centre. The Kicks Inclusion Camp, which is supported by the Premier League and Steve Morgan Foundation, is run throughout the year, providing free sports activities for children, young people and adults with additional learning, behaviour, physical and sensory needs across the Liverpool City Region. All members of the camp â€“ ranging from the age of five to 65 â€“ have varying disabilities, both physical and neurological. The session saw them take part in a range of football drills and activities within their age groups before Bajcetic and Jaros arrived to surprise them. Read more here: https://lnkd.in/gyuseTcq

LFC's friendly double-header at Anfield on Sunday wrapped up an impactful summer pre-season on and off the pitch. The return to Anfield followed a 12-day trip to the USA, the clubâ€™s first Stateside visit for five years Find out more about the four wins, USA return, broken records and LFC Foundation impact in this pre-season round-up with comments from head coach Arne Slot and LFC chief executive officer Billy Hogan https://lnkd.in/eptAH6uv

Liverpool FC has officially been named the most-watched club in the Premier League across the world last season, breaking audience records along the way. Recently released independent data from Nielsen revealed that during the 2023-24 season the Reds were the most-watched Premier League club globally, with a cumulative audience of 471 million for all 38 league games. Read more here https://lnkd.in/eth-AEaw

Liverpool Football Club has supported two local LGBT+ charities with a donation of Â£15,000 raised from sales of its popular retail Pride range. The Michael Causer Foundation and Young Person's Advisory Service (YPAS) are the recipients of the donation which will support their important work with the LGBT+ community across the Liverpool City Region. The donation is made up of proceeds raised over a three-year period from sales of the clubâ€™s Pride range, which was launched in 2019 and includes a range of colourful items from t-shirts and hoodies to flags and souvenirs. Read more here: https://lnkd.in/eKEf6Xvd

LFC Foundation is once again challenging supporters to swap their bed for a sleeping bag for just one night to raise vital awareness and funds for thousands of people sleeping rough across the UK. The â€˜Kip on the Kopâ€™ event is a fundraising challenge that doesnâ€™t replicate what itâ€™s like for those who are forced to sleep rough, but it gives an idea of the situation that many people find themselves in, while also supporting those who face this as a reality every night. LFC Foundation successfully launched its first â€˜Kip on the Kopâ€™ last year, with more than Â£65,000 raised to help tackle homelessness across the Liverpool City Region. Read more here: https://lnkd.in/ezVNvQF7

Liverpool Football Club and Lucozade have proudly joined forces as official global partners, with the iconic British drinks brand set to become the club's official sports hydration partner. The multi-year partnership will also see a range of Lucozade Sport products and hardware continue to have a significant presence at Anfield on matchdays, as well as the AXA Training Centre and AXA Melwood Training Centre. As the UKâ€™s number one sports drink, Lucozade Sport brings a rich heritage of sporting accolades. Liverpool FC and Lucozade have a deep-rooted history having first partnered together in 2010, and memorably showcasing Liverpool FC Legends such as Steven Gerrard and John Barnes in historic Lucozade ads. Learn more about the new partnership here: https://lnkd.in/ep-aGhsj

Liverpool's iconic Anfield has received a Wi-Fi upgrade in time for the new season, providing fans with faster internet speeds, enhanced connectivity and improved performance. The new Wi-Fi 6 network â€“ provided by Extreme Networks, the clubâ€™s official Wi-Fi network solutions and analytics partner â€“ will deliver high-speed wireless connectivity throughout the stadium. With this upgrade, fans can look forward to an improved in-stadium fan experience, allowing them to better take advantage of the clubâ€™s digital offerings including the official LFC app, mobile ticketing, membership rewards, and cash free concessions. Read more about the Wi-Fi upgrade here: https://lnkd.in/dTq_k7v8

Liverpool FC can confirm that three Barclays Womenâ€™s Super League fixtures will be held at Anfield in the 2024-25 season. Liverpool FC Womenâ€™s home league games against Manchester City (Sunday October 13), Manchester United (Sunday March 16) and Everton (Sunday May 4) will be played at Anfield, with each match scheduled to kick off at 2pm. Anfield will be used alongside LFC Womenâ€™s new home, St Helens Stadium, and this follows the clubâ€™s announcement in May regarding its ambition to hold more womenâ€™s games at Anfield and build on last seasonâ€™s Merseyside derby, which played out in front of more than 23,000 supporters in L4. A special Anfield Hat-Trick Package is being launched for fans to be able to buy one ticket to access all three games at the stadium and secure a seat at a discounted price. More details here https://lnkd.in/eBp4MepJ

Liverpool FCâ€™s official travel partner, Expedia Group, is expanding its free transport scheme to include all Barclays Womenâ€™s Super League matches for the forthcoming season â€“ home and away. This fan initiative, which is now heading into its third season, initially started to bring more supporters to away games. Starting off with one coach, in its second season Expedia added a second coach due to the popularity and positive reaction from fans. Find out more and how to book via the link https://lnkd.in/eB8aznQF

First game for LFCW at St Helens to be a Merseyside Derby Ahead of the start of the new Womenâ€™s Super League season, Liverpool Football Club is excited to announce there will be a friendly at St Helens against Everton. This will be the first match for Matt Beardâ€™s side at their new home stadium in a pre-season Merseyside Derby. The game on the Sunday 15 September kicks off at 2pm BST and will be the final game in their pre-season programme. The match at St.Helens R.F.C. will be open to fans and more information on how to buy tickets is available here https://lnkd.in/eZG69_w5
